resources.string: Don\'t have an account in Supla Cloud yet?
Tap the account to log in.
Account by that name already exists
New client registration disabled. Please log in to \"Supla Cloud\" and enable ‚ÄúNew client registration‚Äù in ‚ÄúSmartphone‚Äù section of the website.
Client activation required. Please log in to \"Supla Cloud\" and assign an ‚ÄúAccess ID‚Äù for this device in ‚ÄúSmartphone‚Äù section of the website.
Device disabled. Please log in to \"Supla Cloud\" and enable this device in ‚ÄúSmartphone‚Äù section of the website.
Host not found. Make sure you are connected to the internet and that an account with the entered email address has been created.
Are you sure you want to delete the account?
Are you sure you want to delete the account? Confirmation will delete all account related widgets.

Did you know that Supla is an open, free project developed by the community? If you like the app, spend a moment on rating it. Thank you for your support!
Add Wizard is only available when server connection has been set based on the email address. (Disable advanced options in your account settings)
Welcome to Add I/O Device Wizard which will help you to add a new device to your system in a few simple steps.
Power up your I/O Device and make sure it is configuration mode - the status LED should be flashing rapidly.
*Configuration mode is enabled by default on brand new products. It can also be enabled manually by pressing and holding CONFIG button or dimmer knob for around 5s.
Before you start, set up your Internet connection with the WiFi also used by the I/O device when connecting with server.
WiFi Network is disabled or it is impossible to read its identifier or name!
For the Add Device Wizard to work properly, the Location service must be enabled on this device. Go to your system settings, then select ‚ÄûLocation‚Äù and make sure it\'s turned on.
WiFi Network configuration can not be added!
Current WiFi Network Data timeout. Go to your Android WiFi settings, select Advanced, then check "Turn on WiFi automatically"
No I/O Devices found! Please check if your I/O Device is ON and in configuration mode.
The settings have been transferred to the I/O device.
The connected device is not compatible with this Wizard!
Connection with the device cannot be set!
This application is not fully authorized. Go to the Application Manager in the System Settings. Find %1$s app and activate all the required authorizations.
The cost in the current month
No chart data available in selected time period.

The valve has been closed in manual or radio mode. Before you open it, make sure it has not been closed due to flooding. To turn off the warning, open the valve manually. Are you sure you want to open it from the application ?!
The valve has been closed in manual or radio mode. Before you open it, make sure it has not been closed due to flooding. To turn off the warning, open the valve manually.
Select the z-wave bridge and then the channel you want to configure.
Welcome to the z-wave bridge configuration wizard. It will allow you to connect your z-wave devices to Supla. Tap \"Next\" to continue.
Before continuing, make sure that all your z-wave devices are online. Pressing \"Next\" will search your z-wave network, which may take from a few seconds to several minutes.
Below are the details of the selected channel. Please specify its purpose by selecting the appropriate function.
Device response not as expected. Method:%1$s Code:%2$s
The channel function change failed. Code %1$s
The channel caption change failed. Code %1$s
The waiting time for basic channel configuration data has expired.
The waiting time for changing the channel function has expired.
The waiting time for changing the channel caption has expired.
The waiting time for the ID of the assigned z-wave device has expired.
The waiting time for the list of z-wave devices has expired.
Select the z-wave device that will be associated with the Supla channel.
Waiting for button press on the z-wave device.
The waiting time for pressing the button has elapsed.
Searching the z-wave network to build a list of devices.
The waiting time to remove the device has expired.
Waiting for confirmation of resetting the z-wave network together with clearing the settings.
The waiting time for the z-wave network reset has expired.
The waiting time for the z-wave device assignment to the channel has elapsed.
The z-wave bridge is not responding. Check if the bridge is connected to the server.
Waiting for the device to be added to the z-wave network.
The waiting time for adding the device to the z-wave network has expired.
Are you sure you want to reset the settings and z-wave network?
The selected z-wave device is already associated with another channel. Are you sure you want to move this device to this channel?
Press back to return to the previous step or \"Exit\" to finish.
This function is not available when the bridge is in slave mode.
Done! Now you can finish the configuration process by pressing \"OK\" or you can press back to configure the next channel or change existing settings.
Are you sure you want to restore the default settings?
You cannot change the function of a channel that belongs to a group.
You cannot change the function of a channel that has a schedule.
You cannot change the function of a channel that is associated with a scene.
Control the dimmer by moving the control button on the brightness slider / wheel.
Switch on and off by tapping the on/off button.
The dimmer will remember the previous brightness setting.
Tap the config icon to adjust dimming settings.

Fine tune the performance of your LED lights by selecting a different dimming mode or change the operating range by moving the dark grey sliders around the wheel to adjust the minimum and maximum brightness levels.

This feature helps LED lamps switch on at low brightness settings by providing an initial boost. Move the dark grey slider around the wheel to increase the boost level at switch-on, indicated by the green line. After the boost the brightness will return to the previously set level.
More information on can be found at
Change the light source lifespan settings
Reset the light source usage counter
The lifespan of the light source is %1$s
The lifespan of the uv radiator is %1$s. Schedule its replacement.
The lifespan of the uv radiator is %1$s. Replace the radiator.
Enter WiFi Network name and password to use with new I/O Device
Timeout for enabling registration has expired!
Oops...! It looks like the Android OS WiFi scanning limit has been reached. Setup can be continued after this window closes.
Please enter your Supla Cloud login details.
Do you want to quit without saving?
Do you want to save the settings?
It is recommended to temporary disable mobile data connection on your device as it may interfere with the configuration process.
You can also change the wake-up settings by pressing the icon below.
*) The entered settings will be applied the next time the node wakes up.
Timeout waiting for z-wave bridge response.
There is a problem communicating with the z-wave device. Check if the device is within range of the bridge.
The LED is on if there is a connection to the server.
The LED is off if there is a connection to the server.
The LED is always off, unless the device is in wifi configuration mode (AP Mode).
The attempt to establish a WiFi connection with the i/o device has failed.
Change the operating range by moving the dark grey sliders around the wheel to adjust the minimum and maximum brightness levels.

This option changes the behavior of the input to which the monostable button is connected. In case the option is disabled, the dimmer stops brightening the light when the full brightness level is reached and in case of dimming, at the lowest brightness level. Enabling this option will switch to the minimum level as soon as the maximum brightness is reached, and in the case of dimming to the maximum value, as soon as the minimum is reached. Brightening / dimming will continue as long as the button is pressed.

The option changes the behavior of the dimmer when the lighting is turned on by using the bistable button. If the option is enabled, the dimmer will set the full brightness level right after turning on the lighting. If the option is disabled, the dimmer will set the brightness level saved before turning off the lighting.
The glass sections are exposed for more than 20 hours, which may adversely affect their life. It is recommended to cover all sections for a minimum of 4 hours in order to regenerate them.
Regeneration initiated after 20 hours of operation is in progress.

If your new I/O device fails to appear in the Supla app please run ‚ÄúAdd I/O Device‚Äù wizard again and refer to the ‚ÄúPrevious State‚Äù information on this page for troubleshooting. ‚ÄúSSID Not Found‚Äù is displayed when the chosen 2.4 GHz network is ether not in range or its name was incorrect.
The power was turned off after the set threshold of the allowable current was exceeded.
The power was turned off after exceeding the set threshold of the allowable current. Are you sure you want to power on?
Are you sure you want to start calibration?
Before turning advanced mode off you need to switch to email authentication and enable automatic server detection.
In Access ID authentication mode you won\'t be able to use automatic "Add device" wizard. However you will still be able to add it by manual "Add device" procedure.
This device does not have any channels visible in the application. To finish configuration go to cloud.supla.org
The function of the channel associated with the action trigger cannot be changed.
The function of the channel associated with the push notification cannot be changed.
The channel function associated with reactions cannot be changed.
Removal of your account failed, please try again
The push notification limit of %1$s per hour has been exceeded.
Swipe gesture to open details was removed, tap on particular channel to open it.
Turn on notifications if you want to be notified!\n\nYou can setup your notifications in Supla Cloud.
How long should the device stay:
Te device will be switched %1$s for %2$s, and then switch %3$s
There are no measurements available yet
Turned off due to open window
Turned off due to the lack of hotel card
Thermostat will stay turned off for\n%1$s
Thermostat will stay in heating mode for\n%1$s
Thermostat will stay in cooling mode for\n%1$s
Tap to select. Press long to modify.
Tap to set selected program. Press long to set quarters.
Black corner indicates current day and hour.
History is disabled for this channel
The app has active limits in battery usage. The widget may work incorrect. Go to settings if you want change to no limits.
